data.name: FreakScence
data.description: FreakScene is an obscene attempt to control or conceal emotions.  Each underlying figure catalogs a moment filled with rage, consumed by laughter, or grief, that is overshadowed by the guilt, confusion, and painstaking desire to escape.

data.name: Vacant Lot
data.description: Vacant Lot explores the complexity and depth of the emotional landscape and depicts emotions as live, dynamic entities that dance with and mock each other within the psyche.

data.name: Atop the Radio Tower
data.description: Atop the Radio Tower plays into the humor that is written into our conceptions of reality by turning the power of truth on its head to explore the influence of ideation.  Each compositional element among the m√©lange of forms is unique and powerful in its own right but interacts with and influences the other elements much like loud sounds, vibrant colors and intense emotions dance and crash in dreams or within the mind.  Conceptually, this piece explores how false memories, dreams and illusions can have a profound influence on self-identity.

data.name: Room with a View
data.type: Oil and Spray Paint on Canvas
data.description: Room with a View was inspired by the dire need to escape the societal pressure to embody a specific identity.  The mystical, red-boxed landscape near the top of this piece suggests the existence of a portal into an ethereal utopia, while the dreamy, psychedelic composition mocks the desperation, impulsivity, and tragedy of a societal revolution.

data.name: Death by Fusion
data.description: Inspired by a codependent relationship, Death by Fusion depicts the meshing of two entities and their seemingly graceful dissociation from one another.  Conceptually, this piece serves as a euphemism for codependency by incorporating simple elements that disregard chaotic intensity and mock cyclical dependence.

data.name: My Halogen Gal
data.type: Oil, Acrylic, and Pastels on Canvase3
